intro: Lagenocarpus rigidus subsp. tremulus, commonly known as the trembling lagenocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its upright, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in racemes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Lagenocarpus.
